data.event: The area now occupied by Murray County was part of the land granted to the Choctaw Nation by the Treaty of Dancing Rabbit Creek in 1820.

event.title: granted to the Choctaw Nation by the Treaty of Dancing Rabbit Creek in 1820

data.event: The area now occupied by Murray County was part of the land granted to the Choctaw Nation by the Treaty of Dancing Rabbit Creek in 1820.

event.title: received part of the land under the Treaty of Doaksville in 1838

data.event: The Chickasaw received part of the land under the Treaty of Doaksville in 1838.

event.title: became part of the Chickasaw Nation in 1855

data.event: The area became part of the Chickasaw Nation in 1855.
Army built Fort Towson (1824); Fort Washita (1842) and Fort Arbuckle (1851) to protect the Chickasaws.
Several were established by the time that a post office was established in 1898.

event.title: acquired by the St. Louis and San Francisco Railway in 1907

data.event: The Sulphur Springs Railway (acquired by the St. Louis and San Francisco Railway in 1907) arrived there in 1902, and the 1904 establishment of Platt National Park, with headquarters at Sulphur, spurred the expansion of services for health-seekers.

The Sulphur Springs Railway (acquired by the St. Louis and San Francisco Railway in 1907) arrived there in 1902, and the 1904 establishment of Platt National Park, with headquarters at Sulphur, spurred the expansion of services for health-seekers.
